p: Securing innovation of food systems in the wake of pandemic has been highlighted in its importance for avoiding a widening of technology and capacity gaps between countries. However, narrowly focused innovation can enable progress toward one objective while hindering or undermining progress toward another. Hence, impact pathways of innovations should be considered across entire food systems, so that synergies and trade-offs between economic, social, and environmental objectives can be identified and managed, and processes be put in place that facilitate the adoption of suitable innovative technologies and practices by society (Herrero et al., 2020).
